reviews.text:
Avevamo voglia di una pizza â€œnon americanaâ€ e attratti dalle recensioni e dalla vicinanza al nostro albergo abbiamo deciso di provare.
Ãˆ stata unâ€™ottima esperienza.
Bel locale, organizzazione super, servizio super (complimenti ad Alessia, simpatica, professionale e mai invadente), ottima la qualitÃ  degli ingredienti!
Prezzi in linea con la cittÃ , il quartiere e il servizio offerto.
Promosso

Had dinner yesterday at Norma and loved it. Even though it was super busy, the service was fast and friendly. The food was delicious and full of authentic flavor. The waitress recommended a wine that paired perfectly with my dish. definitely recommend!!

This place has the best pizza I've ever had in my life. The crust is thinner but airy and light and the red sauce is to die for! If you're looking for authentic Sicilian food, definitely visit this place. It's a cute place for date night in the evening or casual eating during the day. Try the Bruschetta and the Prosciutto pizza!!

Save your money!!! The food was awful, so salty I might as well have ordered a brick of salt. Our waiter was extremely rude. The only time he came to our table was to take our order in which he seemed so bothered by and to drop off the food. He also made rude facial gestures anytime he was asked a question.Very bad experience..

It can get a bit loud and crowded, especially on a Friday evening, but Norma has a wonderful selection of reasonably priced bottles of wine, the pizza is phenomenal, as are the Arancini! My family loves coming to this little local gem.

Very disappointed experience. Myself and one other person in my party was very ill after eating that night. I called and spoke to the manager  and he said there is nothing he could do. I told him I had my leftovers (most of the meal, I'd only taken a few bites) in the fridge and could return it.
He didn't care basically saying it can't be proven I was sick from their food. It was my first meal of the day..
Martinaâ€™s was fabulous !  Canâ€™t wait to return and enjoy fabulous food as well !!
Great small place of Italian style. Everything was delicious while the Octopus Carpaccio is a must-try dish
Good service, friendly and attentive waitress, best pizza in nyc, cozy patio, arancini must try, good wine recommendations, good atmosphere, new favorite restaurant..

Burrata y 3 pizzas para 4 personas y la verdad que muy contentos. Calidad - precio muy bien. Sabiendo que  estamos en NY.
Aproximadamente 115$ con propina
Absolutely delicious. This was our favourite meal in NYC. Pizza and gnocchi were both very good. Service excellent as well.
Had a wonderful dinner at Norma last week. Our waitress was knowledgeable and extremely attentive. Everything we ordered was excellent. Weâ€™ll be returning!

I have always been a frequent customer of this restaurant because the food is excellent, but unfortunately the service has dropped a lot by a waitress.(Alessia) In several visits I have noticed that she is not attentive to tables or orders, and instead she spends it talking or flirting with some colleagues from the same restaurant

It's a shame, because the place has a very good atmosphere, but this type of behavior takes away professionalism from the service. Hopefully the administration will take these details into account, since it affects the experience of those of us who are going to enjoy good food and attention.

From the moment we walked in, this Sicilian gem felt like a little slice of the Mediterranean. The ambiance was warm and rustic, with soft lighting, The food was incredible! The arancini were perfectly crisp on the outside, creamy and flavorful within. The lasagna was a standout!

But what truly elevated our evening was the service, especially our waitress, Alessa (I hope Iâ€™m spelling that right!). She was absolutely wonderful. Attentive, genuinely knowledgeable about the menu, and full of great wine recommendations. Her warmth and charm made us feel like welcome guests rather than just customers. Itâ€™s rare to come across someone who clearly loves what they do, and she brought an extra layer of hospitality that made our dinner unforgettable.

Weâ€™ll absolutely be back! not just for the amazing food, but for the heart and soul this place puts into every detail.

Had a wonderful dinner - authentic Italian flavors, cozy ambiance, and standout service!!Our server Alessia was exceptional: warm, attentive, and genuinely passionate about the menu.

She made a great recommendation for a wine pairing and ensured everything ran smoothly. A true professional who elevated the whole experience. Highly recommend!

Norma is definitely my favourite pizza spot in town! The food is amazing and the staff is always welcoming and nice.

My husband and I are regulars here and keep coming back not only for the delicious pizza but also because the team makes every visit special.

Alessia is always incredibly kind, professional and attentive â€” she makes us feel at home every time.
We also love Davide, whoâ€™s always friendly and warm.

If you want real Italian pizza and great vibes, Norma is the spot! ğŸ˜
Best Italian pizza spot in Manhattan, and trust me: Iâ€™m Italian. Super service: thank you Alessia and Davide, youâ€™re amazing!!!

Love this place â€” the pizza is one of my favorites in NYC for wood fired pizza. Get the octopus appetizer. The pasta is also delish â€” we got the gnocchi but the goat cheese w lamb ragu one is also delish.
A very nice Italian restaurant with very good food, and service! The people working there were really nice and friendly! The food amazing, a true Italian pizza!
Norma is a super charming Sicilian restaurant on 9th Avenue. Their food is AMAZING because of their pasta is homemade. The service was top notch. We were served by Martina and she was super lovely!
Great pizza

AMAZING! The food was delicious! I had the gnocchi bolognese and it was probably the best gnocchi I have ever had! The sauce was delicious and I tried several of the other dishes at my table and they were all so good!

If you are to get one thing here get the mortadella pizza. I donâ€™t eat pork so I substituted with beef. Still 10/10 godly. 1st pic is beef version. 2nd pic is pork version.

They got other good items but honestly nothing is nearly as good as that pizza.
The â€diavoloâ€œ was one of the best pizzas I ever had.
i had the burrata appetizer and the margarita pasta with anchovy and bread crumbs â€¦â€¦ really enjoyed the wine and cannolis as well!
Just magical. Service is also nice; they can manage a wine suggestion for a mixed set of dishes beautifully.
Best pizza ever!

Iâ€™ve been coming to this restaurant for the past 6â€“7 years, and thereâ€™s truly no other place that makes me feel closer to Italy than Norma.
Today, Sep 6th, 2025, I went with my wife and a friend to enjoy a pizza. We sat, we ate, we laughed, and I had the pleasure of meeting Stefano and the wonderful staff.
The atmosphere, the way the team works together, and the level of service are all absolutely top-notch. Compared to 6â€“7 years ago, prices have definitely gone up probably about double, but the taste of Italia is still here in every bite of their pizza and pasta.
Thank you, Stefano and team. I completely understand that this is the price we gladly pay to experience a true piece of Italia in the US.
Grazie mille Stefano
Great place, love the Cabbuci's

We love  the friendly service at Normaâ€™s
Try the rice balls, ragu tagliatelle,  salads, pizzaâ€¦their tomato sauce is out of this worldâ€¦everything is consistently delicious and fresh.
Disfrutamos mucho en familia, gran comida, excelente servicio, nos hicieron sentir bienvenidos en todo momento con recomendaciones del menÃº y vinos.
Great food and friendly staff!

Quality Italian food, the lasagna was perfectly cooked and with several layers of pasta, bÃ©chamel and sauce. Very nice selection of wine from Italy.  Next time Iâ€™d like to try the gnocchi dish, as we saw several people enjoying it. The waitress was patient with my elderly parents, thank you !
Great Food and great place!! Super cozy and great service

We went in during dinner time and grabbed a table immediately, the wine we got was very good. Their bread starter and the eggplant crostini was amazing. However the Câ€™antrovas pasta and the margaritas pizza was alright
Love this place.

Le coca de 237 ml est trÃ¨s cher!
Les plats pas extraordinaires.
La pizza 4 fromages Ã©tait sans trop de saveurs et les arranchinis trop salÃ©s! Et je mâ€™en sors avec un mal au ventreâ€¦
It was great experience
Stopped in on Saturday for a pizza. some of the best pizza I ever had, and the service was great too. A+  Thank you

Ristorante italiano di ottima qualitÃ , portate abbondanti e saporite. Da Norma tra lâ€™altro , ho mangiato la migliore pizza che abbia mai mangiato in vita mia, nonostante a Napoli sono stata nelle migliori pizzerie.. da tornarci!
Definitely try it, best pasta always coming back for it.
overhyped.  totally tasty food, but nothing special about it.  service was quick and friendly.
the other day , the bald guy, giovani was horrible he had such an attitude i almost canâ€™t believe how ridiculous the service was. i definitely WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.
Generous portions, friendly service and easy to get a table for lunch. Gluten free pizza had too much water content and I didnâ€™t love the sauce, but everything else was good.
We were looking for a real italian pizza in nyc and we found probably the best one in the city. The pizza was delicious and the service was top-notch, Alessia did a wonderful job. Weâ€™ll be back!
Everything was AMAZING. Canâ€™t wait to come back ğŸ¤
Great pizza..great, friendly service. Definitely worth a visit.

My friend and I took our 3 boys to Norma's on Sunday July 20th. Food was okay but service was the worst. Our waitress, Alessia, never smiled or greeted us, just asked for our order and then later brought our check. When we asked her about some of the dishes she almost seemed bothered by it. She was all smiles with her colleagues. Not sure what she didn't like about us. I asked the host at the door if there was a manager on site, he said no and kept on walking. Didn't bother asking if I needed anything. Must say these people like the host and Alessia needs to go through customer service training. I have been to Norma's before as it is in my neighborhood. But never again thanks to Alessia's lack of service. Only good service was from Miguel.
Pizza crust was light, fluffy, and just the right amount of greasy. Hazelnut ice cream affogato highly recommended.
Good pizzas in this nice restaurant in the earth of New York. Good service, very interesting choice of Sicilian dishes.

Amazing dinner.  I was traveling solo and arrived for an early dinner.  They greeted me warmly and despite being a party of 1, they seated me at a great table and not relegated to the bar.  Everything was delicious and the service was great. The gnocchi was perfect. So good!

Really cosy setting, great service and the food was absolutely delicious. I had the swordfish pasta with a tomato sauce, almonds and eggplant. Hands down one of the better pasta dishes I've ever eaten. If you're in the area and want Italian, this is a must go. Pricing very decent for being New York City as well.

Wow! What an amazing little spot.  We arrived about 10 minutes after opening on a Sunday and it quickly filled up. It is so cute inside and a well thought out space but the food is definitely the star here.  We were served fresh crusty bread with olive oil immediately after sitting down.  We started with an arugula salad with pears which was well seasoned and heaping in fresh Parmesan cheese. I had the lasagna which literally melts in your mouth, the pasta is paper thin and layered in a delicious ragu. My husband has the pasta trapanese pesto. The pasta noodles were cooked all dente and the sauce was fresh and light.  Every single thing we had was a 10/10. Will def be back!

As far as authentic Italian restaurants go, this fits the bill perfectly. My pizza was absolutely amazing, with fresh delicious vegetables. Service was amazing too, Stefano was really attentive and friendly. A very charming spot, full of character and great value for money. It now lives on my NYC favourites list ğŸ

Cute neighborhood spot for regional Sicilian cuisine.  Tasted authentic.  The pizza looked outstanding but we went with arincini and pasta with a ragu with eggplant and peas.  Great pasta.
We left happy.
Amazing food. I highly recommend the gnocchi. Also, the prices are very reasonable considering the Michelin awards hanging in the front window.

Enjoyed a lot in Norma. Good Pizza and Pasta and the service with the Italian staff member was just excellent.
The restaurant feels and taste authentic and is very charming.
The food was prepared super fast and was just on point, the Pizza dough is excellent.
This is a gem in NY and the prices are pretty good.
Totally recommend it.

So far, my favorite Italian restaurant in this area. Comfortable dining experience with a cozy seating and friendly staff. I like the their pizza (I forgot the name, but we ordered a veggie pizza with eggplant on it) more than other famous pizza restaurants. On the flip side, their famous rice ball was not very impressive to me, although it tasted good. Generally, I will definitely come again!

I love service here: polite and friendly, fast.
I ordered Gnocchi with beef. Gnocchi was perfect cooked. I can't say that this experiment with to add beef to this dish was lucky. I prefer more a classic Gnocchi. My rate is 4 from 5.
The wine was smooth and tasty.
There are many tables, but they are located close to each other. I want more private (especially in winter time, because you have to look for a place for your voluminous jacket). It would be nice to have a separate hanger for such cases.
The overall rate is 5 from 5.
Thanks

First time visiting and the food and service was top of the line!
We ordered the Burrata for appetizer, and the lasagna parlemitana with busiate al pesto trapanese, everything was amazingly tasty. My only complaint was the tiny table you get for a party of 2. The place is small and cozy but I feel a true Italian cuisine restaurant deserve the table space to put the entire meal.
Honestly, the delicious food, the attentive service and the amazing wine made me forget about the tiny table. â¤ï¸
Thank you Giovanni for a great evening and accommodating my mom and in a more comfortable space ğŸ¤—

Great little place that we accidently stumbled upon. We ordered a few appetizer/starter dishes tuna, octopus, and veal. They were all terrific. The waitress seemed a bit disinterested in us but the food was served promptly.

I donâ€™t know if I came on a bad day, but to say that I was disappointed is an understatement. I came here thinking this was one of the best places for pizza in Kips Bay. However, both the pizza and the plate were soaking wet. See attached photos. I hope I just came on a bad day.

Trenette al pomodoro $20.00 éºµæ¢éå¸¸ç‰¹æ®Šä¸¦å‹é“ï¼Œç•ªèŒ„åŸºåº•ï¼Œæ»¿é¹¹é‡å£çš„ã€‚Busiate al pesto Trapanese $24.00 æ‰‹å·¥éºµé«”å¾ˆç‰¹åˆ¥ï¼Œä¸€æ¨£é‡å£é¹¹ï¼Œå¥½åƒçš„ã€‚Pizza Margherita $18.00 éå¸¸ç†±çš„ä¸Šæ¡Œï¼Œèµ·å¸èåŒ–éå¸¸é¦™æ¿ƒï¼Œè–„çš®ï¼Œéå¸¸æ»¿è¶³ã€‚ç”œé»éƒ¨åˆ†Tiramisu $12.00 ä¸åƒä¸€èˆ¬é¤å»³æ·±è‰²çš„å¯å¯ç²‰ï¼Œè€Œæ˜¯æ·¡å’–å•¡è‰²çš„ï¼Œå¾ˆç¾ä¸¦ä¸”è£¡é¢å…§é¤¡å¥¶é¦™é¦™æ¿ƒï¼Œéå¸¸æ¨è–¦ï¼æœå‹™å¾ˆè¦ªåˆ‡ï¼Œä¸€ç›´æœƒé—œæ³¨å‹•å‘ï¼Œä¸¦ä¸”è£œå……å…è²»çš„æ°´ï¼Œä»‹ç´¹èœå–®ä»”ç´°ï¼Œå¸Œæœ›å¯ä»¥å†è¨ªã€‚
Great fresh pasta including some Sicilian specialities. Friendly service from authentic Italians. Enjoyed it. Will be back. Pesto was excellent as was the Anelletti (not pictured)

Had dinner in the back patio and it was great. Although it was hot, they had ceiling fans and it worked out just fine. The food was amazing and itâ€™s always a place that we know it wonâ€™t let us down. We had a salad and a pizza and two pastas.

We had been here two years ago and came back â€” itâ€™s still just as enjoyable. The food is absolutely delicious, the setting is great, and the staff is very friendlyâ€¦ all at very reasonable prices for New York. You can go there with complete confidence.

Quaint store with super kind and quick staff. I was eating by myself and ordered a Margherita pizza and I was in and out in 15 min. I was sat immediately upon entering and my server Luca came up to me about a minute later to take my order, that came out in less than five minutes. Iâ€™m a quick eater so I finished it in about 10 min. I would say that it was a 12-14 inch pizza. Check came quickly but I was told I could wait a bit. Didnâ€™t feel like they were trying to flip tables and get me out of there which was great! Pizza is saucy which I loved! All around a great experience.

Delicious food. Great atmosphere. Wonderful service. We were a party of 3 and had to wait on a sat night but it was worth it. Order the pizza. The pizza crust was incredible. It was crisp and airy. The pastas and riceballs were amazing too.

Norma is an absolute gem! My husband and I went there for the first time to celebrate his birthday and we are definitely coming back as many times as we can. The food is the definition of authentic and delicious! Our server Luca was extraordinary and made the whole experience even better. If you go there and he recommends something go with it because he knows what he is talking about. The place is small but we were lucky to be seated at a corner table so it was cozy. Also the dinner experience is very well paced. We 100% recommend Norma.

This restaurant is amazing! I have been there two times and both times the food was amazing! It is a small place but it is totally a gem ğŸ’ if you are in Manhattan go there! You donâ€™t need a reservation, but of course if they are busy you may have to wait. This Italian restaurant very unique and with a delicious food! From the antipasto to the dessert totally worth it.

Excellent service and even better food. Starting with the fresh bread basket, everything is of high quality with excellent flavors. We were lucky to arrive early enough to get a table with no wait but the place filled up quickly on a Friday evening.

Nice little Sicilian restaurant in Kips Bay Manhattan. Great food at decent prices. Servers were friendly and helpful. Great cozy ambience.
However I am giving  a 4 star because i wonder how i ended up paying 30% tips went i had chosen 20% on the machine. Didn't notice the amount until i left the restaurant.!

The Norma pizza was worth the price. The pizza had fresh eggplants, ricotta salata, mozzarella, and tomato sauce. The crust was perfectly cooked and was fluffy and slightly charred. Based on flavor alone, the pizza may have been the best thing I have had in the city. My friend really loved the lasagna he ordered. We both were stuffed after we had our meals. Additionally, the servers are very friendly and the restaurant has a beautiful brick walls and feels like you are in an old Italian familyâ€™s kitchen. I loved it!
great Sicilian pasta dishes, wonderful neapolitan Pizza and the panelle are super nice

This is one of those tough ones where the service, atmosphere, and wine are great but the food is exceptionally mediocre to bad. The potato croquettes were good and had solid flavor. The pizza is where things went downhill fast. The margarita pizza sauce 100% tasted like Campbells. I was shocked. Not my preferred flavor. The Quattro formaggio was okay but Iâ€™ve had better. Would I personally get pizza from here again? No.

Locale molto carino ed accogliente con personale gentile e servizio super veloce.
Abbiamo provato la pizza, la classica Margherita ed era ottima! Lâ€™unica cosa che non ho apprezzato tantissimo era la nota di pepe che abbiamo avvertito, probabilmente proveniente dal sugo! Comunque voto altissimo! Impasto buono e leggero!
Abbiamo provato anche il tiramisÃ¹, molto buono anche quello! Ve la consiglio.

Eating hear now and itâ€™s horrible. The service is badâ€¦. The server asked me if I wanted water as I was sitting down. Then came back two minutes later to take my order, I wasnâ€™t ready then it seems as if she left with an attitude. I ordered an eggplant pizza and it was horrible, soooo soft and not tasty at allâ€¦. Never ever felt so uncomfortable. It was my little birthday dinner with myself after leaving the spa. Today was going so well, my me time birthday until now, I am super annoyedğŸ¤¯

Quaint and cozy Italian restaurant. The margherita and porcini mushroom white pizza were good - especially the crust which was light and chewy. The pizzas were lukewarm which was the only downside. We also got the pesto pasta and eggplant appetizer which were all very good. You need to ask the servers for complementary bread and olive oil.
